com.alexkasko.unsafe.bytearray

Class ByteArrayTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.alexkasko.unsafe.bytearray.ByteArrayTool
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitShiftLittleEndianByteArrayTool, UnsafeByteArrayTool

    public abstract class ByteArrayTool
extends Object
    Front-end class for operations over byte arrays. Default implementation uses sun.misc.Unsafe with assert boundary checks. To enable boundary check use -ea java switch, without boundary checks invalid input will crash (segfault) JVM. Fallback implementation uses standard byte array access and bit shifting. Unsafe implementation uses native endianness (LE on most platforms). Fallback implementation uses Little Endian byte order.
    Author:
    alexkasko Date: 12/11/12

      • copy

        public abstract void copy(byte[] src,
        int srcPos,
        byte[] dest,
        int destPos,
        int length)
        Copies part of one array into another. Unsafe implementation has less bounds checks (if assertions are disabled in runtime) then System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int) that is used by fallback implementation uses
        Parameters:
        src - source array
        srcPos - source array position
        dest - destination array
        destPos - destination array position
        length - length to copy
